title: Watercrook Roman Fort and Settlement
description: The Roman Fort near Watercrook Farm (at Kendal in northwest England) was originally built ca. AD 90 and rebuilt ca. AD 130. It may have been called Alone?/Alauna? in antiquity. Its poorly preserved remains are coincident with those of a contemporaneous civilian settlement.

properties.description: Representative Point Location based on OpenStreetMap. Dates after BAtlas.
properties.title: OSM Location of Watercrook Roman Fort
